content.rendered:
This Week in Genesis, food bloggers rejoice, a new foodie theme is here (and a new recipe plugin is coming soon); plus a deep dive into the world of Genesis starter themes; and not one, not two, but three new Genesis podcasts just for you.

Let’s get to it!

—

Themes

The fine folk over at Feast Design (the same peeps behind the Foodie Pro and Brunch Pro themes) have got a new theme out this week, Cook’d Pro. And, as you might expect, it looks pretty sweet!

The new Cook'd Pro theme by @feastdesignco is simply delicious — https://t.co/ckViIDlS70 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/5CGQLjjauG

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 16, 2016

In related news, Feast have also teamed up with the good people over at WP Site Care to launch a new recipe plugin, Cookbook. It’s not out yet but is available for pre-order (could be a good one for all your foodie clients…).

Start and grow your blog with a recipe plugin that actually works — https://t.co/Apyw0aajjb via @feastdesignco @wpsitecare

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 17, 2016

And, elsewhere in theme news, Imagely (creator of many fine Genesis photography themes) have now launched their own lifetime all themes and plugins deal.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, lifetime deal now available on all @imagely themes & plugins https://t.co/OUwMAsPo8T pic.twitter.com/JFCw5gbL8Q

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 12, 2016

Showcase

Lovely site from Pilcrow Pixel for jamesmorganfilms.com

Just launched: new site for London-based independent production company James Morgan Films: https://t.co/avLYqqtF4S #genesiswp

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) August 18, 2016

A hot new design for Sugar Rae’s pushfire.com (h/t Brian Gardner)

Forgot to mention on my pers account – @PushFire is rocking a new logo and a new #genesiswp child theme this week. https://t.co/GfcVTPHMi8

— Rae Hoffman (@sugarrae) August 12, 2016

Murray AC with not one but two new sites, portdouglassportfishing.com.au and noysthaimassage.com.au

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds 2 new showcase sites by @memurrayac https://t.co/FIx9rSLrkB & https://t.co/bGAixHifwa pic.twitter.com/fQIYFpfqji

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 15, 2016

BobWP re-launches his dothewoopodcast.com site (in record time) on the new Smart Passive Income Pro theme.

Do the Woo Gets a New Look : The Smart Passive Income Pro Child Theme. https://t.co/0DndxTjS2O #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/3Pip6l1iDH

— BobWP (@bobWP) August 12, 2016

And finally, thought I’d showcase one of my own sites for a change. For top designer, Chuck Green (all design credit to him, of course), a relaunch of ideabook.com

New #genesiswp site from me this week – loved putting this together – for top designer Chuck Green (@ideabook) https://t.co/M2W53iHYno

— Nick Davis (@iamnickdavis) August 19, 2016

Podcasts

This week on StudioPress.fm it’s the story of

The Creative Process Behind the StudioPress Redesign — https://t.co/IKhms1ng0i pic.twitter.com/esv4qAXShH

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 17, 2016

It’s here, if you didn’t listen to Episode 0 (and you should go back and listen to that too) you can now get Episode 1 of Jackie D’Elia’s rethink.fm. Now also available on iTunes and other popular podcast players.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVo4c50, Episode 1 of Rethink.fm w/ @jdelia chatting to @Lockedown_ on Content First strategy https://t.co/4GdrVvPZXf

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 12, 2016

While over on the Do The Woo podcast, Bob Dunn chats about his relaunch on the new Smart Passive Income Pro theme from StudioPress.

How @bobWP re-launched his site within hours of our Smart Passive Income Pro theme release — https://t.co/uXGpjDtH0d #genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 12, 2016

Best of the rest

Nice post on Genesis starter themes by Chris Mcintosh.

Starter themes are super influential to a workflow. Why I'm building my own & some other awesome options. https://t.co/ewJxA3OvtL #genesiswp

— Chris Mcintosh (@akamac) August 17, 2016

Big shout out to Nick Diego and Gary Jones who have been polluting my inbox with GitHub notifications filling me with joy as they did some great work on the Genesis changelog this week.

Maps props to @nickmdiego and @garyj for the work they’ve done on the #genesiswp changelog.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 16, 2016

Sridhar with a nice (free) and updated tutorial on how to set up Google Custom Search in Genesis.

How to set up Google Custom Search in Genesis:https://t.co/CajnRePqjC#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/EU4lqdpUtJ

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 14, 2016

Anita on why centering your content is a bad idea.

Why Centering Your Content is a Bad Idea https://t.co/86THxZQpyh #webdevelopment #bloggers #bbloggers #fbloggers #wordpress #genesiswp

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) August 17, 2016

And finally…

This is your final warning, if you didn’t update to Genesis 2.3.1 yet, make sure you do so before updating to WordPress 4.6, as in stop what you’re doing and go do it right now!

ATTN Genesis users: Please updated to v 2.3.1 before updating to WP 4.6. More info —> https://t.co/j8VLWYyh1b #genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 16, 2016

And if you were too late and something break, check out this quick fix guide from Sal.

If you updated WordPress before updating #genesiswp and get an error, read this fix. https://t.co/dv0scF6dkS

— Tony Brennan (@BrennanTony) August 17, 2016

—

That’s all for this week, I’ll be back next Friday with more Genesis goodness for you all.

Until then, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

excerpt.rendered: A new foodie theme is here (and a new recipe plugin is coming soon); plus a deep dive into the world of Genesis starter themes; and three new Genesis podcasts just for you.
